quote.author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote.content: Either war is obsolete or men are.

quote.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote.content: We have to face the fact that either all of us are going to die together or we are going to learn to live together and if we are to live together we have to talk.

quote.author: Issac Asimov
quote.content: Violence is the first refuge of the incompetent.

quote.author: Herbert Hoover
quote.content: Older men declare war. But it's the youth who must fight and die!

quote.author: Jeannette Rankin, First Woman Member of Congress
quote.content: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.

quote.author: General Omar Bradley
quote.content: In war there is no prize for the runner-up.

quote.author: Winston Churchill
quote.content: When you have to kill a man it costs nothing to be polite.

quote.author: Albert Einstein
quote.content: The pioneers of a warless world are the youth that refuse military service.

quote.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
quote.content: Our only hope today lies in our ability to recapture the revolutionary spirit and go into a sometimes hostile world declaring eternal hostility to poverty, racism, and militarism.

quote.author: Ernest Hemmingway
quote.content: They wrote in the old days that it is sweet and fitting to die for one's country. But in modern war, there is nothing sweet nor fitting in your dying. You will die like a dog for no good reason.
